1.text: And when Jacob shall see there is selling in Egypt, Jacob will say to his sons, For what will ye look?

2.text: Behold I heard that there is selling in Egypt: go ye there, and buy grain for us from thence; and we shall live and shall not die.

3.text: And Joseph’s brethren, the ten, will go to buy grain from Egypt.

4.text: And Benjamin, Josephs brother, Jacob sent not with his brethren; for he said, Lest harm should meet him.

5.text: And the sons of Israel will come to buy in the midst of those coming; for the famine was in the land of Canaan.

6.text: And Joseph, he the ruler over the land, and he selling grain to all the people of the earth; and Joseph’s brethren will come, and will worship before him the face to the earth.

7.text: And Joseph will see his brethren, and will know them, and he will not let himself be known to them. And will speak with them hard things: and he will say to them, From whence came ye? And they will say, From the land of Canaan to buy food.

8.text: And Joseph will know his brethren, and they knew him not.

9.text: And Joseph will remember the dreams which he dreamed concerning them, and he will say to them, Ye spying; to see the naked places of the land ye came.

10.text: And they will say to him, Nay my lord, and thy servants came to buy food.

11.text: We all one man’s sons; we true; we thy servants were not spying.

12.text: And he will say to them, Nay, to see the naked places of the land ye came.

13.text: And they will say, Thy servants twelve brethren; we the sons of one man in the land of Canaan: and behold, the little one with our father this day, and one, not.

14.text: And Joseph will say to them, This which I spake to you, saying, Ye spying:

15.text: In this ye shall be proved; Pharaoh living, if ye shall go forth from here except in the coming of your brother, the little one hither.

16.text: Send one of you and he shall take your brother, and ye to be bound, and your words shall be proved, whether the truth with you; and if not, Pharaoh living, for ye are spying.

17.text: And he will gather them to guard three days.

18.text: And Joseph will say to them in the third day, This do ye, and live, I fearing God.

19.text: If ye true, one of your brethren shall be bound in the house of your guard, and ye yourselves go carry the selling for the famine of your houses.

20.text: And ye shall bring your little brother to me, and your words shall be believed, and ye shall not die. And they will do so.

21.text: And they will say, a man to his brother, Truly we guilty concerning our brother, when we saw the straits of his soul in his entreating us, and we heard him not; for this, these straits are come to us.

22.text: And Reuben will answer them, saying, Spake I not to you, saying, Ye shall not sin against the child; and ye heard not? and also behold his blood was required.

23.text: And they will not know that Joseph heard them, for an interpreter between them.

24.text: And he will turn about from them, and will weep; and he will turn back to them and speak to them, and he will take from them Simeon, and will bind him before their eyes.

25.text: And Joseph will command, and they will fill their vessels with grain, and turn back their silver to a man, into his sack, and give to them provision for the way: and he will do thus to them.

26.text: And they will lift up the grain upon their asses, and they will go from thence.

27.text: And the one will open his sack to give food to his ass in the lodging place, and he will see his silver; for behold, it in the mouth of his sack.

28.text: And he will say to his brethren, My silver restored; and also behold in my sack: and their heart will go forth and they will tremble, a man saying to his brother, What this God did to us?

29.text: And they will come to Jacob their father, to the land of Canaan, and they will announce to him all having happened to them, saying,

30.text: The man, the lord of the land, spake to us hard things, and he will give us for spying the land.

31.text: And we shall say to him, We are true; we were not spying;

32.text: We are twelve brethren, sons of our father: one is not, and the little one, he with our father in the land of Canaan.

33.text: And the man, the lord of the land, will say to us, In this I shall know that ye are true; leave one of your brethren with me, and take for the famine of your houses and go.

34.text: And bring your little brother to me, and I shall know that ye are not spying, but ye are true: I will give to you your brother and ye shall traffic in the land.

35.text: And it will be in their emptying their sacks, and behold, the bundle of silver of each in his sack: and they will see the bundles of their silver, they and their father, and they will be afraid.

36.text: And Jacob their father will say to them, Me ye bereaved of children: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and ye will take Benjamin: all these things were against me.

37.text: And Reuben will speak to his father, saying, Kill my two sons, if I shall not bring him to thee: give him into my hand, and I will turn him back to thee.

38.text: And he will say, My son shall not go down with you, for his brother died, and he alone was left: and harm meeting him in the way in which ye shall go, and ye bring down my old age with grief to hades.
